website_summaries.verdict: The set includes useful extras such as a recipe ebook and cook's glove. Cast iron construction is a major consideration with tortilla presses, and this model uses a very high grade. Great for small restaurants.
pros: High-quality cast iron provides additional pressing power
Built to last for years, even with commercial use
Consistent results, especially with wax paper or plastic wrap
cons: Some users disappointed with its smaller dimensions
Cast iron can be too heavy and challenging to maintain
Better for high volume users, not casual cooks

customer_reviews.title: Great tortilla press
customer_reviews.text: Before this purchase, we owned a 6" aluminum tortilla press that was adequate at best. This cast iron unit makes pressing tortillas so much easier and faster! Just pressing down on the top plate by hand and then finishing up using the lever makes tortillas as thin as you want! Looking forward to many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I use the New York Times Food Blog ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I use the New York Times Food Blog Recipe for Corn Tortillas and they come out awesome. It's important to use plastic between the dough and the press. I take a large zip lock bag, and split two sides (Leaving one folded side). You can reuse the bag several times. For the best shape I put the dough ball somewhat off-centered, closer to the hinge.
customer_reviews.author: Jess RoyMitchell

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The product description sounded good. The reality is this isn’t a quality product. Handle secures with a little cotter pin really flimsy. The handle is meant to apply the pressure to flatten the tortilla. I note another review said the handle snapped. I believe that!No instructions or recipe book included. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Sheets

customer_reviews.title: The press does not press flat. One side, ...
customer_reviews.text: The press does not press flat. One side, the hinge side, always remains farther apart than the press side. Makes very small tortillas, even when using a very large amount of dough.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Legg

customer_reviews.title: I just purchased this tortilla press, and it seems ...
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this tortilla press, and it seems to be high quality. I will review more after I have tried it out. I have since used it once, and it is fine. I like the larger size, as the masa doesn't overflow. It cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Jambor

customer_reviews.title: The opposite of whimpy!
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy as expected as cast iron is. I had a little problem with the handle because my dough is thick to begin with and it held the handle up. After using a lot of strength and I got it thin enough the handle would work. I am using tapioca & almond flour for my tortillas and maybe that is why it is a little stiffer than other doughs. Meanwhile this seems truly heavy duty and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Missing integral parts
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it would be a good product except for the fact that they neglected to pack the arm and bolt to connect the arm... So it's useless and they want me to send it back to get a refund. Where am I supposed to get the supplies to send back something this heavy? I don't have packing tape... I don't have a printer to print out a label and I am not breaking quarantine. All I want is for them to send the missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: JULIE S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tortilla Press
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Using this tortilla press now makes making uniformly thin corn tortillas fun and a snap to make. The tortilla press is well-made and should last a long time. It does require a super simple assembly to attach the handle. All the necessary parts are included, so no worries.
customer_reviews.author: ladyctexas

customer_reviews.title: Easily get rustic
customer_reviews.text: This product does not come with a manual so we are not sure how to care for it. like all the other new products, I washed it with water. after wiping it, I saw rust build up. I cleaned it with soap again and wiped it with oil, managed to get most of it out. But I'm not comfortable using it with all that rust.
customer_reviews.author: farhina

customer_reviews.title: Check the underside of the press if you can’t find the handle attachment pin.
customer_reviews.text: I had originally posted a one star review as I couldn’t find a pin included to attach the handle. I was wrong I found the pin stuck to the underside of the press after I wrote the review. I apologize. I’m thrilled with my purchase! The weight of the cast iron flattens the tortillas pretty much effortlessly! I know I have a product that will last a lifetime!
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy, solid press and will last lifetimes.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Reed

customer_reviews.title: Press is great,  Did not receive the link to the ebook.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the press and the glove. However, there was no information as to how to access the ebook. If I were to be able to get to the ebook I would be happy with the entire experience.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Risher

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This seems like it is a high quality tortilla press. We are excited to use it! It is heavy and seems sturdy. The first one arrived without the handle, but after contacting the seller, they sent me a replacement right away - great support from them. The second one had all the pieces and we look forward to using it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Keep it seasoned unless you want to waste plastic every time.
customer_reviews.text: For anyone saying you must use plastic to keep from sticking if you keep it well seasones that isnt necessary. Peels right off no prob
customer_reviews.author: Jumpingal

customer_reviews.title: So far...just okay.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is easy to put together and easy to use. Problem is it does not flatten enough for good thin (regular, standard thin) tortillas and doesn't flatten completely straight. Works better for gorditas and empanadas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RUSTED
customer_reviews.text: It came rusted with a big chunk missing and did not come with recipe book as advertised. I’ll make it work but highly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Groovy
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a cooking class and had to have one. It is very easy to use and very sturdy; the thing will outlast me for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. It is cast so have to keep it oiled so it will not rust for those of you do not know...
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Much better corn tortillas
customer_reviews.text: This makes corn tortilla making super easy and they taste much better than the store bought ones. I’ve found that the tortillas are easier to manage when they are on the wet side. Also I place two sheets of heavy plastic from a 1 gallon size freezer bag and put your masa ball between these when pressing for easier release.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: My husband broke our first one with excessive force (recipe without enough liquid). Comapny shipped us a new one which is still working perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: AEH

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron press
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use it to start my Indian fry bread disks. I even take it camping.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect and came with a glove
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Works perfect and came with a glove! No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Roselyn

customer_reviews.title: Look for another one
customer_reviews.text: The tortilla press leave it uneven thicker in some areas. I am not impressed. It is a nice cast iron, just doesn’t work
customer_reviews.author: allison srabian

customer_reviews.title: EBook not cookbook
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing about this was that it came early. There was no instructions, no how to care for instructions, no code to download the ebook. Then you can't contact the seller by phone to resolve what was a minor issue! So glad this Christmas gift didn't have to be done by Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: alexander olivo

customer_reviews.title: I LOVEIt! The pin doesn’t stay in place, ...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVEIt! The pin doesn’t stay in place, but other than a minor issue, I used it the for the first time for my dough to make Empanadas.

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift and apparently rarely used. But when used, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn

customer_reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY  !
customer_reviews.text: DOES A GREAT JOB ! iF THE DOE IS NO TOO THICK ! YOU CAN WHIP UP A BATCH IN A SHORT TIME WITH LITTLE EFFORT !

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Lose hinge, surface is not level. This meant it did not close completely and did not really flatten the tortillas. You can get better results with a rolling pin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lot easier than rolling out the dough. Very heavy, seems stout. Useful in rolling out pita bread dough also.

customer_reviews.text: This did not make my tortillas nearly thin enough for my taste. Returned.

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! We have been making corn tortillas in it and it makes perfect little tacos or street tacos! Yum!

customer_reviews.text: I love it! It makes perfect, round tortillas. You can even cook the tortillas on it (I don't). It comes with an oven mit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Todd

customer_reviews.title: Broke in first use
customer_reviews.text: This press doesn’t flatten out the dough like a tortilla should be. After pressing a few tortilla the handle snapped off. Needless to say this is going back! Save $30 and use a rolling pin. It doesn’t take any more effort for a much better tortilla.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great , well made addition to any kitchen, fun too!
customer_reviews.text: Watched lots of tutorials on making tortillas, the first try was a success! Great item to have if store made tortillas are in short supply you simply make your own!

customer_reviews.title: Great press
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I'm making tortillas often and I love the free pot holder.

customer_reviews.title: This cast iron tortilla press is not the best. The dough sticks even with oil or parchment ...
customer_reviews.text: This cast iron tortilla press is not the best. The dough sticks even with oil or parchment paper. The sides also becomes very thin and hard.
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Didn't receive the recipe book as advertised. The press itself looks and feels sturdy , not a fake lightweight or painted press. Im happy about that. Cant wait to use it.

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't for me, it was for my Granddaughter ...
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't for me, it was for my Granddaughter in Denver. She likes it and has used it several times.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had an aluminum press and this is way better. The leverage is perfect.

customer_reviews.text: I used it for our annual tamale making party. Mucho easier than using a spoon to spread the Masa

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this item. It did not press the dough thin enough. You had to put all your weight into it. Much prefer my rolling pin.

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with any directions on how to put it together, so I still haven't used it.

customer_reviews.text: Great product. Heavy duty and very easy to use. Makes perfectly flat tortillas. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.text: tortilla press was delivered ahead of schedule and contained all it was supposed to

customer_reviews.text: Came on time looks great nice n heavy but didn't come with instructions or recipes but it did come with the mitten

customer_reviews.title: exactly as advertised. really heavy and solidly built. ...
customer_reviews.text: exactly as advertised. really heavy and solidly built. my tortilla game has been taken to the next level!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas B. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and it works great
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and it works great! if you're a rookie you use the weight of the top and only give it a little pressure. If you're only halfway intelligent you'll get the hang of it in about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this tortilla press
customer_reviews.text: Solid and well made! Very happy with this tortilla press!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Hegarty

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was what it said it was, but needed some additional seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew bishop

customer_reviews.title: awsome press
customer_reviews.text: this is better than expected, no problems, I'm strong and I needed a durable product, thanks
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Cage

customer_reviews.title: Very well made!
customer_reviews.text: I love quality manufacturing, it is hunt to find well made kitchen equipment of all kinds, be it thongs or knives, quality shows. I see it as a love for your own product and that always impresses me. This product shows all the Care and love for their product. It is extremely well made and would last hundreds of years. No kidding! You will be very happy. I do need a complete instruction and recipe guide. I hoped that would be part of this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: florida

customer_reviews.title: I'm a tortilla factory now!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this tortilla press. It's solidly built and the weight of the iron makes it easy to use. As others have said, placing the ball of dough a bit off center towards the hinge side creates perfectly round, evenly thick tortillas every time. I've been making cassava flour tortillas with it. A sheet of parchment paper folded in half to cover top and bottom plates so that the press doesn't actually touch the dough means easy transfer to the pan and no clean up. I can see that this is going to get a lot of use. So much easier than using a rolling pin like I was doing before! The oven mitt that comes with is pretty nice too.
customer_reviews.author: c_from_Cali

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: This press works well for my needs. We live in Mexico part of the year so we are a bit addicted to tacos. I've been using store bought and experimenting to find the one most to our liking...but after our last trip it was clear making them fresh was the way to go. My understanding is presses like this aren't the best for flour tortillas but for corn tortillas it works great. There are lots of cast iron tortilla presses on Amazon but it just so happens I needed a new oven mitt, so that's why I got this. There is no book, however.
customer_reviews.author: A. Park

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice --- a rolling pin actually works just as well though.
customer_reviews.author: the girls

customer_reviews.title: homemade tortillas are worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out last night. Easy to use, tortillas were amazing. I can't believe I've been buying tortillas from the store all these years.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Quality is poor, I think this was used before I got it
customer_reviews.text: Not really happy about how it looks pocked and can't really season the darn thing either, no way to get the pin out to do so and its rusting right there where the pin is as well, not really impressed by the metal but was told it was high quality, hmmm. Oh and the black is rubbing off on my fingers some when trying to use it as a tortilla press. I asked Lodge to make one cause I would rather have American made.
customer_reviews.author: rll1980

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love my new tortilla press! It makes my job so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with a tortilla press!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it!! Well once she opens it for her birthday. She picked it out but doesn’t know I got it for her shhh.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fonseca

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet but it looks great! In addition I received a Hot mitt as a gift, which I was not expecting. They also sent me a nice email with an easy to read recipe. I'm looking forward to taco night!
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: No lever, no hinge pins... so I’m out $30 for a product I can’t even use.

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: NO E-BOOK PDF AND THE TOP PLATE HAS BIG RAISED BLOBS, WHICH WILL CLEARLY MARK THE TORTILLA
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a simple product, nothing complicated about, ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple product , nothing complicated about , two moving parts, and they can't include all the parts, come on.12 miles to the nearest hardware store to get a pin for the handle and they don't have a 3/16 hitch pin so had to use a cotter pin. All in all it looks well made but the pressing surface is a little rough, guess i'll smooth it up a bit. So this product is going to cost me another 30 $ to get it right. oh well live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: friend

customer_reviews.title: Two out of three.
customer_reviews.text: The tortilla press is fine. The oven glove fits. But the BBQ recipe book did NOT arrive. Please send one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift so I haven't used it. I was impressed with the quality and construction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use it, but it did not come as advertised. The ad says it comes with a cookbook, which it definitely doesn't. False advertising
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great but you will need to use either wax paper ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great but you will need to use either wax paper or clear wrap so the tortillas don't stick. I think it won't be any different no matter which on you buy though. I like wrap and wrap the bottom and top and then just press away at tortillas.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: This is what you need to make tortillas
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what people expect when buying this. It's nothing more than a press to flatten the dough ball. It replaces the hand roller work. Absolutely must use plastic or parchment above and below the dough ball, them one press and the flattened tortilla is ready for the pan. Heavy, just as it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy Bob

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can adjust the thickness and it is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: phillycat

customer_reviews.title: Great for keto tortillas
customer_reviews.text: I got this today and made low carb tortillas with Maria Emmerich’s recipe, which is 1 1/4c almond flour, 3 1/2T psyllium husk powder, 1 tsp salt, 2 lg eggs, and 1 c boiling hot water for 10 tortillas. The press made it so quick and easy. I rolled balls, 50g each, sprayed parchment with oil and put the ball in the middle of the press between two parchment sheets and pressed until they were nearly to the edge. Peeled off the parchment and toasted on the griddle with a little coconut oil. Awesome!! Way easier and faster than a rolling pin, and perfect shape. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Karen B Mielke

customer_reviews.title: It's easy enough to fabricate something much stronger that will beef ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for making homemade tortillas, flour or corn, but the material quality of the pins at the hinge points just isn't there. The rest of it is decent quality cast iron which for pressing tortillas is more than adequate; just not sure why the company decided to not spend the extra minimal expense required to beef up the hinge pins. It's easy enough to fabricate something much stronger that will beef up the hinges for about a $2 at a hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Higgy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome time saver!
customer_reviews.text: This press use was nearly effortless in making thin Lahmajun dough. The lever handle and top plate are much heavier than what I have used in the past so the added weight definitely helped in thin dough circles. I was overly pleased at how much time I saved with this press because before I had to press and then use a rolling pin. Awesome time saver!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett M.

customer_reviews.title: It's fun to experiment with recipes for both flour and corn ...
customer_reviews.text: This tortilla press definitely gets the job done. It's fun to experiment with recipes for both flour and corn tortillas, but I definitely had more luck with the corn ones. The flour ones stuck to the waxed paper I was using to cover both sides of the press per online suggestions. I tried parchment paper with the corn tortillas and it seemed to work much better. Not nearly as much sticking. It would be nice if the press could be used without any type of covering.
customer_reviews.author: Janet from Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: A bit tricky at first getting the ball size and positioning just right on the press so things aren't squishing out everywhere, but the learning curve is short and pro status is obtained pretty fast. I make low-carb tortillas with this press using a cut gallon-sized ziploc bag to "sandwich" the dough and get great results every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love this press! I have used it to make gluten free tortillas, corn tortillas, gluten free sandwich wraps and flat bread. It is great quality and easy to use and care for. I use a little coconut oil on the surface to prevent sticking between every couple of presses (you could also use parchment paper). It has stayed well seasoned and like new. It came pre-seasoned, but I reasoned the first few uses to make sure it was well oiled. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby N.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once so far and so far so good. Some ratings stated it doesn’t press evenly. It does’t but if you don’t press the tortilla too flat the first time, you just rotate it and press gently once more. I like cast iron. The weight of it begins pressing without being pushed on. If the dough is too stiff it may require more pressure and I can see where that might pose a problem. I won’t be doing that.
customer_reviews.author: K. Young

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I got it a week or so ago and have used it twice. LOVE IT!! I've never made tortillas before, but it was super easy and the press works like a charm. It's fun too. It's heavy duty and, as long as the cotter pin hangs in there, should last a lifetime. I'm very glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: ginabina

customer_reviews.title: I like it. I suggest using wax paper when pressing ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I suggest using wax paper when pressing the dough. The dough will stick to the press.
customer_reviews.author: JDUB

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tortilla press at the beginning of lockdown and it arrived without the screw to hold the handle on. Without a handle it is useless. I did not take it to UPS for a return because of the lockdown so now I am stuck with a heavy useless piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kdg75

customer_reviews.title: ... change the old one that I have and didn't like the iron cast
customer_reviews.text: I bought the iron cast to change the old one that I have and didn't like the iron cast, it feels so fragile when putting pressure the tortillas comes out one side thick and the other side thin
customer_reviews.author: Edith Bustos

customer_reviews.title: Missing book
customer_reviews.text: Like others... received press and mitt but no book. Really disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Foz426

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent press, it is well made and works with little effort. Very pleased with this purchase and the fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Valsi

customer_reviews.title: ... owned a tortilla press before and this is just amazing! I look forward to making many tortillas for ...
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a tortilla press before and this is just amazing! I look forward to making many tortillas for my family. I just realized it has a ecookbook, that I have not seen. If you can send me the link that would be great! I'm excited! Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C. Azzari

customer_reviews.title: Muy bien!
customer_reviews.text: Presses the heck out of corn tortillas, and quickly too!
customer_reviews.author: thelare

customer_reviews.title: Great company and attractive tortilla press.
customer_reviews.text: This company oozes of excellent customer service. The tortilla press is very attractive, sturdy and is everything one would hope in a tortilla press. When the press arrived, it was missing a small pin that clamps the larger pin in place making the handle more secure. With no argument, they sent me another brand new press, and it arrived in 2 days. I cant be more thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: ETS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Press
customer_reviews.text: Nice press.well built. I only wish that the cook book was a hard copy not digital.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Solid and flattens tacos
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my husband for Father's day and he loved it. We used it today and it was great! Easy to clean, flattens taco easily. Highly recommend. Solid and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Lilender

customer_reviews.title: Barbacue book not included... Better deals on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: The product of the Tortilla press came as promised, and you got a mitt, but being one of the higher priced presses, it arrived without the book(let) so I believe there are comparable products that are a more decent value on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kohlman

customer_reviews.title: time for home made tocos
customer_reviews.text: my wife loves it - that is all that matters - quality material well made enough to flatten the corn or flour and stove cook

customer_reviews.text: This unit warks great! Like the weight.Does not slide around, Makes even tortillas with very little effort.Highly recommend this press.

customer_reviews.text: The tortillas do not press evenly so they tear if you don’t leave them thick...so why bother....due to covid missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Tortillas and empanadas for days!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute must if you want to make you want tortillas or empanadas. My only complaint is that the hinge is a smoke pin and is a little loose.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: It’s warped, with a quarter inch gap on one side in the middle of the top plate.
customer_reviews.text: Update. I have a replacement on the way and should be here in three days. I will update this review when I get it. I’m quite disappointed. The top plate is warped and has a 1/4” gap in the middle. I’d try to fix it but, cast iron doesn’t bend very well. If the manufacturer had any type of quality control it this would have been caught. Why did you mail me this?
customer_reviews.author: Mark mcvicker

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making eight inch tortillas. Cast iron is nice and heavy so you don’t have to press hard to get your batter flattened. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Boomers Mom

customer_reviews.title: t like it much
customer_reviews.text: it is for tortillas and not for pastry. You have to be very carefull when pressing as the handle is not that strong. I really didn;t like it much. Even the tortilla mass does not flatten very well using this thing.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Makes it so easy to make Keto tortillas; naan; Keto crackers and I’m sure I’ll find more ways to use it.
customer_reviews.author: joseph garland

customer_reviews.title: Excelent, it was what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Excelent, it was what I expected. My dad in law ask me to buy it for him to use it in his restaurant and he love it. Perfect to make tortillas
customer_reviews.author: Gisselle

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I made tortillas twice already
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I made tortillas twice already. It does NOT go in the oven... haha its just to press them. It works really nice. All my tortillas have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Keata

customer_reviews.title: The press was very easy to use and the cast iron construction makes it ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this immediately after receiving it. The press was very easy to use and the cast iron construction makes it very durable.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Made my life so much easier when I make cassava flour tortillas for paleo eating. Get it!

product_meta.title: Tortilla Press Pre seasoned by Iron World - Cast Iron Pataconera Press Seasoned 8 inch Heavy Gauge. Great for Flour Corn Tortilla
product_meta.description:
Iron World Hand Made Tortilla Press

Enough with those store-bought tortillas!
Prepare fresh and healthy tortillas at home 

We at Iron World are casting pure Iron by following a traditional ancient technique to produce the best available kitchen ware.
Our Tortilla press is perfect for preparing Tortillas, patacones, tostones, empanadas & arepas.

All our products are carefully made by hand with great love.
We believe our Iron Cast products are the best in the market and as a proof we give you, our customer, a 5 year full warranty.

Our goal - only satisfied customers!
feature_bullets: Our offer includes: Cast Iron Tortilla Press 8", Iron World Chef Glove and a 28 page e-Book with mouth watering BBQ recipes.
Handcrafted to Last for Years: Made using ancient Chinese techniques, your cast iron tortilla press features an ultra-durable design with pre-seasoned, non-stick coating that improves with use.
We Believe our Traditional Hand Made Iron Casting Technique makes the Best Tortilla Press so we are Confident and Proud to Give a “Lifetime Guarantee”
Simple to use - just place your tortilla dough in the center of the press plate, close and press. So simple and so healthy.
